title: I feel new Swain and Vlad have too similar designs.
body:
And yes I mean the long hair and red magic aspect. 

I’m admittedly kinda annoyed that Swain was turned into Lucious Malfoy. Swain’s original crippled and ravenlike appearance was a classic example of don’t judge a book by his cover (or don’t fully judge it). He was charismatic despite looking like a creepy neighbor and very respectful to individuals based on their capabilities, only expressing anger towards people like J4. 

This new Swain looks like he could smooth talk you. He still has some hard and focused gaze, but I expect him to lead now through strength, while old Swain lead through cunning, making him a strange oddity but a great example of the Noxian way. 

He looks too much like bloodlord Vlad to me I guess.  

Maybe if his hair was black, idk.

replies.body:
Yea, probably my biggest gripe about new Swain is the clarity issues.

He looks too much like Vlad, and his spells in base are the same color so you can easily confuse both of them in a teamfight. 

His W when playing against a TF, could make an ally or himself think TF is ulting if they're standing under it, OR it can make them miss that TF is ulting because they'll think its just Swain's W. Additionally they can overlap each other, so you won't actually see one or the other depending on where your camera angle is. Stuff like Eve charm, rengo R, etc all have distinct shapes to avoid this issue or other effects (like VOs, screen shading, etc). For this all there is, is a circle on the ground and we already know how many of those there are in this game. 

______

Also the ultimate looks underwhelming, I mean he went from demonic bird man that drained the life out of everybody around him, to grow some wings and at the end of it, burst based on your stacks.

______

Where's beatrice.. 

I'm going to try and reserve judgement until I actually play him, because its not the most misleading character design for swain (rather close if not better actually), but that's the first impressions. Skins are hella good now though.

and then have their visual effects similar

Vlad Q - red particle being sucked in
Swain Passive - red particle being sucked in
Swain E - a red particle being sent out and pulled back in

Vlad Q - Narrow red particle
Swain Q - Narrow red particles

Vlad E - Aoe red particle
Swain Q - a spray like red particle from long distance that kinda works like Vlad's E but not a full 360. 
Swain R - an AoE red particle

there are most definitely connections or moments where you need to blink first to find out who is who, especially in teamfights where a lot is happening and you have no clue if you're focusing the long hair warlock in a dark cape, or the hemomancer with long hair in a dark cape, and you don't know who's spells you're really dodging when the game already is hard to tell what is going on in teamfights.

He does look like BL Vladimir, though. He is a white-long-haired warlock with a dark and heavy armor and red-particled skills. My personal grip about it is that, while it fits Vlad greatly, it is pretty awkward on Swain. 
Vladimir is inspired off of the vampire archetype (though he isn't one). Vampires were based off of aristocrats, and their stories are often interpreted as a critique to the way powerful and rich people exploited (sucked the life out of) lower classes. A great symbol of this is long hair, as taking care of your hair demands a lot of time. Swain, on the other hand, doesn't fit that type of person, and this is even worse when you realize in his old lore he pulled noxian support out of representing the noxus ideal.

Why should a power manifest in the color of the character's nation? There should be no correlation between these two. What happened to individual diversity? If the color of character abilities are limited to the monotonous colors of their nation, this game is visually going to become very dull.
